intro: Adinandra nunkokensis, commonly known as the Nunkok mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary and secondary tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
